title: Microwave Radiation
brief: Microwave ovens emit non-ionizing radiation that is safe for heating food and doesn't cause cancer
myth: Microwaves cause cancer and make food radioactive
reality: FDA-regulated microwaves are safe. Non-ionizing radiation only heats food without altering its molecular structure
tips: Don't stand directly in front while operating

title: Charging Cables & EMF
brief: Phone chargers emit electromagnetic fields (EMFs) that may disrupt sleep and melatonin production
myth: Charging devices near you is harmless
reality: EMFs from charging cables can affect sleep quality. WHO classifies EMFs as 'possibly carcinogenic'
tips: Charge devices at least 6 feet from bed
Charge during day, not at night

title: Nonstick Cookware (PFAS)
brief: Nonstick pans contain PFAS 'forever chemicals' that can release toxic fumes when overheated above 500°F
myth: All nonstick pans are safe to use
reality: PFAS chemicals linked to kidney, testicular, and thyroid cancers. Can cause 'Teflon flu' when overheated
tips: Switch to cast iron or ceramic

title: Plastic Food Containers
brief: Plastic containers leach BPA, phthalates, and microplastics into food, especially when heated or scratched
reality: BPA replacements (BPS, BPF) may be equally harmful. Microplastics linked to heart disease and cancer
tips: Avoid storing acidic/fatty foods in plastic

title: Air Fresheners & Plugins
brief: Air fresheners emit toxic VOCs including formaldehyde, benzene, and toluene that pollute indoor air
myth: Air fresheners clean and purify the air
reality: They mask odors while releasing carcinogens. Can trigger asthma, headaches, and respiratory issues

title: Scented Candles
brief: Paraffin wax candles release benzene, toluene, and soot that can cause cancer and respiratory damage
myth: Scented candles create a healthy, relaxing atmosphere
reality: Petroleum-based candles emit carcinogens. Can cause headaches, asthma, and long-term lung damage

title: Dryer Sheets & Fabric Softeners
brief: Contain quaternary ammonium compounds, phthalates, and VOCs linked to respiratory issues and cancer
myth: Dryer sheets just make clothes soft and smell fresh
reality: Chemicals include benzyl acetate (pancreatic cancer link), chloroform, and neurotoxins
tips: Add white vinegar to rinse cycle

title: Mixing Cleaning Products
brief: Bleach mixed with ammonia or vinegar creates deadly chloramine or chlorine gas
myth: Combining cleaners makes them more powerful
reality: Creates toxic gases causing respiratory damage, chemical burns, and can be fatal in high doses
tips: Use one product at a time

title: LED Blue Light Exposure
brief: Blue light from LEDs and screens suppresses melatonin and disrupts circadian rhythms
myth: LED lights are just energy-efficient and harmless
reality: Night exposure linked to sleep disorders, obesity, diabetes, and increased disease risk

title: Aluminum Foil with Acidic Foods
brief: Cooking acidic foods (tomatoes, citrus) in aluminum foil causes metal leaching into food
myth: Aluminum foil is safe for all cooking
reality: Acid + heat dissolves protective oxide layer. High aluminum linked to neurotoxicity risks
tips: Never use with steel pans (galvanic corrosion)

title: New Carpet VOCs
brief: New carpets off-gas formaldehyde, benzene, and styrene for weeks to months after installation
myth: That 'new carpet smell' means it's clean
reality: VOC emissions peak in first 72 hours. Can cause headaches, dizziness, respiratory issues, and asthma
tips: Choose low-VOC or natural fiber carpets
Consider cork, tile, or wood flooring

title: Household Cleaning Products
brief: Common cleaners contain formaldehyde, benzene, and VOCs that are suspected carcinogens
myth: Commercial cleaners are regulated and safe
reality: Many contain reproductive hormone disruptors, asthma inducers, and human carcinogens
tips: Choose EPA Safer Choice certified products
